title: Effect of hindlimb unloading on healing of medial collateral ligaments in rats
description: Rat ligaments under hindlimb unloading (simulated microgravity) showed delayed healing due to altered cell matrix interactions, modeling injury recovery challenges in space.
authors: Juan Li, Peter C. Johnson, David A. Hart

title: Martian regolith as a substrate for plant growth
description: Wheat plants in Martian regolith simulant exhibited limited growth and stress responses under simulated low-gravity conditions, informing plant adaptation for Mars.
authors: John Z. Kiss, Anna-Lisa Paul, Robert J. Ferl

title: Spaceflight effects on plant development
description: Arabidopsis plants on ISS displayed altered cell wall structure and gravity sensing under microgravity, essential for plant growth in space habitats.
authors: Simon Gilroy, Sarah E. Wyatt, John Z. Kiss

title: Gene expression profiling of C. elegans under various thermal conditions
description: C. elegans worms under low temperatures simulating space transport showed metabolic shifts in microgravity-like conditions, applicable to multi-cellular responses.
authors: Nathaniel J. Szewczyk, Akira Higashibata, Shuji Honda

title: Microgravity effect on C. elegans N2/VC (CERISE 8days)
description: C. elegans in real microgravity on ISS altered muscle and neuronal functions, providing a model for organism-level physiological changes.
authors: Akira Higashibata, Nathaniel J. Szewczyk, Timothy G. Hammond

title: Rodent Research-1 liver data
description: Mouse liver in spaceflight microgravity showed metabolic and oxidative stress alterations, modeling organ responses for human analogs.
authors: Timothy G. Hammond, J. Kirk Shelley, Patricia C. Allen

title: Bacillus subtilis strains at low-pressure: 5 kPa versus 101 kPa growth
description: Bacillus growth in low-pressure (Mars simulation with microgravity elements) altered gene expression, for microbial survival in extraterrestrial conditions.
authors: Wayne L. Nicholson, Douglas S. Clark, Patricia Fajardo-Cavazos

title: A study of alterations in DNA epigenetic modifications (5mC and 5hmC) and gene expression influenced by simulated microgravity in human lymphoblastoid cells
description: Human immune cells in simulated microgravity exhibited epigenetic and gene changes, affecting immune function for space health risks.
authors: Honglu Wu, Kamal J. Abdel-Fattah, Yumin Chang

title: Gene-expression profiling of Saccharomyces cerevisiae irradiated by high-LET radiations
description: Yeast in high-LET radiation (with microgravity simulation) showed DNA repair changes, modeling eukaryotic responses to space stressors.
authors: Cheryl A. Kerwin, Louis S. Stodola, Sylvia Y. Roneker

title: Rodent Research-1 (CASIS): Mouse liver expression data
description: Mouse liver post-microgravity flight showed lipid metabolism shifts, for mammalian organ adaptation.
authors: Timothy G. Hammond, J. Kirk Shelley, Patricia C. Allen

title: Rodent Research-2 (CASIS): Mouse liver expression data
description: Extended microgravity altered mouse liver signaling, revealing long-term stress mechanisms.
